eu.clementime.rds
Class Screen

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      org.anddev.andengine.ui.activity.BaseActivity
          org.anddev.andengine.ui.activity.BaseGameActivity
              eu.clementime.rds.Screen
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnAreaTouchListener, org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnSceneTouchListener, org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.detector.ClickDetector.IClickDetectorListener, org.anddev.andengine.sensor.accelerometer.IAccelerometerListener, org.anddev.andengine.ui.IGameInterface
public class Screen
extends org.anddev.andengine.ui.activity.BaseGameActivity
implements org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnAreaTouchListener, org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnSceneTouchListener, org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.detector.ClickDetector.IClickDetectorListener, org.anddev.andengine.sensor.accelerometer.IAccelerometerListener

Screen class is the main class of the game, and manages starting/closing game, player touch, loop game and running animations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Clément

status

private int status
The 3 status, associated with one mode, indicate what sort of things the doll is allowed to do.

- Action (= can walk, take, talk, look, exit),
- Inventory (= inventory is open),
- Animation (doll is doing something, as talking, or an animation is running)

See Also:
mode

mode

private int mode
The mode specifies the status and depends on it; it indicates precisely what doll is doing.

Action status allows 2 modes:
> Walk,
> Wait (for an action: action manager is visible),

Inventory status allows 3 modes:
> Open (zoom is closed, click to open zoom or drag an item),
> Zoom (zoom is open, click to close or drag an item),
> Drop (player is dragging an item onto something else, zoomed item or screen item),

Animation status allows 2 modes:
> Action (doll is looking, moving toward an item or an exit)
> Talk (doll is talking),
> Animation is running (player must wait until this animation is finished).

See Also:
status

clickCheck

private int clickCheck
Used to know when and where a click happened.

Completes status and mode.

pendingTriggerId

private int pendingTriggerId
Used to know if there is another animation to be triggered after the running animation.

loadResources

private void loadResources()
Persistent objects (= not depending on screen: doll, game tools, inventory, fonts, talk bubbles, etc...) are created and corresponding sprites loaded. This is a one-run method, at start.

public org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene onLoadScene()
AndEngine one-run method, at start.

Specified by:
onLoadScene in interface org.anddev.andengine.ui.IGameInterface

setLoop

private void setLoop()
This is the loop of the game (into onUpdate() method). Manages running animations and doll chasing (= moving camera & game tools as doll is walking).
Be careful not putting more that necessary inside the loop.
This is a one-run method, at start.

checkStopDoll

private boolean checkStopDoll(float pSecondsElapsed)
When the doll is moving, checkStopDoll() checks if the doll must stop or not, depending on the current action (simple walking, continuous walking, taking, etc...). When the doll stops, actions are done, if needed, as taking, talking or going to next screen by an exit. Be careful, this method is called inside the loop. That is why the displaying of the log is delayed in this method.

Parameters:
pSecondsElapsed - time since last update on screen

onLoadComplete

public void onLoadComplete()
AndEngine one-run method, at start.

Specified by:
onLoadComplete in interface org.anddev.andengine.ui.IGameInterface

loadNewScreen

private void loadNewScreen()
Load a new screen when starting game or leaving screen for another by an exit.

This method retrieve doll starting position from database and create a new background (screen, items, animations...) without displaying it yet.

First, whatever the case, it looks for:
- player last position (player carry on playing a previous game),

But if doll comes from another screen by an exit, this starting position is updated by:
- new screen starting position,

If not, and if there is no previous position (= x < -300), this is a new game, and method retrieve:
- first screen starting position.

createNewBackground

private void createNewBackground(int screenId)
Creates a new background object.

Parameters:
screenId - id of the newly created screen

initNewScreen

public void initNewScreen()
Display a new screen. Everything was loaded previously in loadNewScreen() method.

onAreaTouched

public boolean onAreaTouched(org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.TouchEvent pSceneTouchEvent,
                             org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.ITouchArea pTouchArea,
                             float pTouchAreaLocalX,
                             float pTouchAreaLocalY)
onAreaTouched activates following sprites when touched: inventory items, talk bubbles, action manager, doll, moving arrows, some animations, exits, dev or setting tools, zoom.

Specified by:
onAreaTouched in interface org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnAreaTouchListener
Parameters:
pSceneTouchEvent - The TouchEvent object containing full information about the event.
pTouchArea - The Scene.ITouchArea that the TouchEvent has been dispatched to.
pTouchAreaLocalX - the x coordinate within the area touched.
pTouchAreaLocalY - the y coordinate within the area touched.
Returns:
true if this Scene.IOnAreaTouchListener has consumed the TouchEvent, false otherwise.

onSceneTouchEvent

public boolean onSceneTouchEvent(org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene pScene,
                                 org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.TouchEvent pSceneTouchEvent)
Used for player actions that do not involved a sprite, for things happening after a TouchArea event, or for cleaning variables after an event.

> Player actions that do not involved a sprite: dragging and dropping inventory items, looking an area on screen or walking,
> Things happening after a TouchArea event: doing actions with action manager or closing inventory,
> cleaning variables if needed: changing status and mode, deactivating game tools or stopping doll.

onSceneTouchEvent() is activated after onAreaTouched().

Specified by:
onSceneTouchEvent in interface org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene.IOnSceneTouchListener
Parameters:
pScene - The Scene that the TouchEvent has been dispatched to.
pSceneTouchEvent - The TouchEvent object containing full information about the event.
Returns:
true if this Scene.IOnSceneTouchListener has consumed the TouchEvent, false otherwise.

doSingleAction

private void doSingleAction(int action)
When there is only one action, don't show action manager (to remove, probably).

manageAction

private void manageAction(float x,
                          float y)
SubMethod of onSceneTouchEvent() method. Do one of the following:
> freeze action manager and move doll towards item if doll is going to take an item, towards character if doll is going to talk to somebody, or towards exit,
> check if there is something to look in the background (screen area),
> let doll starting walking (to a point or continuously, it will be checked after by checkStopDoll() method),
> show animated circle or pointer.

Parameters:
x - x touched by the player (on the whole AndEngine scene, which means on the whole background image, not local x on screen)
y - y touched by the player (for this application = local y because there is no way to scroll vertically)
See Also:
onSceneTouchEvent(org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene, org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.TouchEvent)

inventoryDragAndDrop

private void inventoryDragAndDrop(org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.TouchEvent pSceneTouchEvent)
SubMethod of onSceneTouchEvent() method, allows drag and drop of inventory items and combination with another inventory item or with a screen item.

Parameters:
pSceneTouchEvent - Android/AndEngine touchEvent (up, down, touched x & y, etc...)
See Also:
onSceneTouchEvent(org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene, org.anddev.andengine.input.touch.TouchEvent)

private void activateMovingArrow(int direction)
Activates moving arrows, i.e. launch left or right moving arrow animation and launch doll moving (will stop moving if reach a border or if player do another action only). SubMethod of onAreaTouched() method.

Parameters:
direction - left arrow or right arrow

launchTrigger

private void launchTrigger(int triggerId,
                           boolean simultaneous)
Activates a trigger which can launch an animation, move the doll, hide the doll, launch a text, etc...

All information about what to do is retrieved into the results tab described below:
> results[0]: next trigger - if there is another trigger launched following this one, id of the trigger, 0 if not
> results[1]: animation on screen - if the trigger is to animate a screenAnim, id of the screeAnim
> results[2]: doll moving - if the trigger is to animate the doll, x where the doll has to be moved
> results[3]: doll is hidden - if doll is moving, it can be off screen
> results[4]: text activated - if an animation text is activated, id of this text
> results[5]: add item to inventory - id of item to add in inventory
> results[6]: doll moving y velocity
> results[7]: hide/show screen item
> results[8]: hide/show animation
> results[9]: simultaneous trigger - if there is another trigger to launch at the same time, id of the trigger

Parameters:
triggerId - is the trigger to launch
simultaneous - if this trigger has to be launch simultaneously another trigger, no pendingTriggerId is set

launchAnim

private void launchAnim(int animId)
Retrieves all information about an animation (number of frames, duration of frames, moving animation or not, etc...) and launches it.

All information about what to do is retrieved into the features tab described below:
features[0] = first_frame
features[1] = last_frame
features[2] = frame_duration
features[3] = loop
features[4] = x_velocity (for a moving animation)
features[5] = y_velocity (for a moving animation)
features[6] = doll_is_hidden

Parameters:
animId - id of the animation to launch and display

checkStopMovingAnimation

private void checkStopMovingAnimation(Anim animation)
Checks if a moving animation (>> an animation getting around the screen, not only playing/running) is finished and has to be stopped (!! >> into the loop).

Parameters:
animation - animation (object, not only id) to be stopped

garbageCollector

private void garbageCollector()
When changing screen, all sprites, touch areas and updatehandlers about this screen have to be removed properly. AndEngine seems not to do the cleaning completely, so to avoid problems, this is better use a clear/systematic garbage collector.

onResume

public void onResume()
Opens the database, reloads new game or old game if necessary (backup exists only in dev).

Overrides:
onResume in class org.anddev.andengine.ui.activity.BaseGameActivity

onPause

public void onPause()
Closes database, save player information or game (backup exists only in dev).

Overrides:
onPause in class org.anddev.andengine.ui.activity.BaseGameActivity
